oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Belmont Heights Baptist Church, 2001 May
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Belmont Heights Baptist Church, located at 2100 Belmont Boulevard, on the southern edge of Belmont University's campus in Nashville, Tennessee. The church has had two sanctuaries. The first sanctuary has a foundation made of rough-cut limestone blocks. Two stone columns stand on either side of the entrance. The doors are metal and glass. The roof is gabled with tar shingles. Windows are clear glass. The structure was built in 1926 and is now used as the School of Nursing building on Belmont campus. The second and current sanctuary has a brick foundation along with brick exterior walls. The doors are wooden. There are four stone columns at the entrance. A tall steeple with windows sits atop the building. There are stone eaves on the portico and wood eaves on the rest of the building. Flashing is copper. Arched side windows are tinted. Small square windows face front. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
